title: Expand MudNavGroup when child MudNavLink matches (i.e. is active) on load
body:
### Feature request type

Enhance component

### Component name

MudNavGroup

### Is your feature request related to a problem?

I have the following structure.  When a page loads and the url matches a child MudNavLink of a MudNavGroup, the group should automatically expand.

```
<MudNavMenu>
  <MudNavGroup>
    <MudNavLink Href="fetchdata" Match="NavLinkMatch.Prefix">
```

### Describe the solution you'd like

automatically expand a group containing an active (especially by match) MudNavLink

### Have you seen this feature anywhere else?

SmartAdmin template (from which I'm upgrading).

### Describe alternatives you've considered

inherit NavLink and add an event for when it matches the current route
inherit MudNavLink and re-raise the event
inherit MudNavGroup and listen for the event and expand accordingly

title: Access modifier protected in components should be private?
body:
I see lots of examples of protected access modifiers in the components that don't make sense to me. See below. If one were to inherit from MudAlert and one did indeed need access to Classname it could easily be changed.  For now I expect this is a hangover from before partial classes when a component had to inherit the code behind and these should be private

@henon 

```
    public partial class MudAlert : MudComponentBase
    {
        protected string Classname =>
        new CssBuilder("mud-alert")
          .AddClass($"mud-alert-{Variant.ToDescriptionString()}-{Severity.ToDescriptionString()}")
          .AddClass($"mud-dense", Dense)
          .AddClass($"mud-square", Square)
          .AddClass($"mud-elevation-{Elevation}")
          .AddClass(Class)
        .Build();
```
author: mikes-gh

comments.body:
The question is this: should we have all component internal things which might be useful in a derived class `protected` in general to allow our users to inherit from our components? That's one reason why I made all protected. The other reason is to distinguish between fields that should not even be touched by a derived class and such which are ok to be touched or overridden. 

Like always, everyone should feel free to voice their opinion about it so we can either certify the strategy or change to a better one.

If you expect members to be accessed from derived types then they should probably be xml documented.
The developers may not be using the source.
In this case its read only access to ClassName from the derived type?
Im trying to work out the use case for this.

I think it is a good way to make them protected. I can imagine a use case, when a derived class want to add a new class above the existing ones and extend the way how an element looks like/behaves. However, currently this is not so easy, because I need to copy everything from the base class. If something likes this would be possible:

`protected override Classname => base.Classname.AddClass("my-class")`

title: Is it possible to customize every component's Class property?
body:
Sometime I want to use some beautiful bootstrap template which has lots of customize css for components, table, button...etc.

As title, is it possible to override MudBlazor components' built-in class?

thank you
author: howardgod

comments.body:
I dont recommend mixing between different css frameworks, and MudBlazor does not have compatability support with other CSS frameworks.

The components in MudBlazor isnt only a native html component + a css class. Most consists of several components with their own css. So the css in MudBlazor is not just ‚Äôplug and play‚Äô with other simpler css frameworks.

This is because good looking Material based components requires a slight more complex DOM compared to other frameworks. If youve seen other frameworks that offers both bootstrap and material ui - youve probably noticed that the material ui looks iffy - because they have the same DOM but only different CSS.

You can, of course, override the stylesheet used in MudBlazor (the individual classes) when needed (just like any stylesheet) but I guess its not what you were after.
Closing due to no response. Hope you are satisfied with the answer!

title: How to set click events on a table row
body:
Hi,

Is it currently possible to have a Click event on MudTable/RowTemplate? I have set hover=true so the whole row is highlighted as expected but can't see how to set a click event. The workaround I am using at the moment is to add a MudLink to a cell but that means the user needs to move the mouse over the link rather just selecting the row and clicking anywhere inside.

If this is not currently possible I think it could be a good enhancement.

Thanks for your good work.

Luis
author: luifer

comments.body: there is SelectedItemChanged which is fired when the row is clicked
this question comes up so often that I am adding a OnRowClick callback to table

Sorry I have not come back earlier. 

Thanks for your reply / enhancement.

I had seen the SelectedItemChanged but somehow thought that it would triggers when a row was selected with the checkbox or after it was edited.
it is not optimal, someone pointed out that it fires not if you click the same row twice as this would not change the selected item. that's why I just added the event callback

When do you think a release will come out with this enhancement? Not urgent for me at the moment but it will be nice to have.

Thanks
I think end of the week or so. We try to release weekly.
great thanks!
Fixed in 1.2.1

title: MudSwitch error when updating from 1.1.5-net5 -> 1.2.0-net5
body:
The line of code below worked in 1.1.5-net, but doesn't in 1.2.0-net5. Note: Perhaps I'm using MudSwitch wrong, I don't know.

**In MainLayout.razor (_in MudAppBar_):**
`<MudSwitch Color="Color.Inherit" CheckedChanged="(() => currentTheme = (currentTheme == defaultTheme) ? darkTheme : defaultTheme)" Class="ma-0" />`

**Error:**
Severity	Code	Description	Project	File	Line	Suppression State
Error	CS0411	The type arguments for method 'TypeInference.CreateMudSwitch_0<T>(RenderTreeBuilder, int, int, EventCallback<T>)' cannot be inferred from the usage. Try specifying the type arguments explicitly.	Mediatheek.Client	D:\Repos\MediatheekNext\Mediatheek\Client\obj\Debug\net5.0\Razor\Shared\MainLayout.razor.g.cs	224	Active
author: JeepNL

comments.body: yes, that is because we made MudSwitch  and MudCheckBox generic types. Please add T="bool" to your MudSwitch

the upside of this change is that a MudSwitch now can be bound to `bool`, `bool?`, `int`, `int?` and `string`. Had you bound it to a boolean variable it would have been inferred without a compilation error. We knew about this potential breaking change, that's why we bumped the minor version. See #206
Yes! It works! Thank you for your reply!

title: Guidance for "substring text selection" in MudText or MudField
body:
This is probably not relevant to MudBlazor but I thought I would ask here anyway. I need a text selection and tagging feature or guidance.

Here is a silly example that gets the idea across:
I have a MudText with some text e.g. "The quick brown fox jumped over the lazy dog"
I want to be able to select a portion of the text using "left click and drag" and on mouse-up I want to show a floating menu with MudButton/ButtonFab. The button click handlers will need to know the selected portion of the text for further processing.
e.g. I will select "fox" and tag it as an "animal" or select "jumped over" and tag it as  "activity". 

If this is not possible with a single MudText, I can also have each word in a separate MudText however I want to be able to select more than one word. I can use any other component as well if that works.

I don't necessarily need a text editor like the one I am using to write this issue. Its static text but I need to be able to select a portion and perform an action on it.
author: danglingneuron

comments.body: Check out the new MudHilighter we just released yesterday, it is not a 100% solution to your problem, but it shows how to style a a part of a text.

title: Set custom current date for MudDatePicker
body:
### Feature request type

Enhance component

### Component name

MudDatePicker

### Is your feature request related to a problem?

Our application functionality is strongly dependent on current date (and time of day). Because of this we use a custom DateTime provider, which sets an arbitrary "current" date and time throughout the application. We use this for development, automated testing and presentations. We pretty much only use real time in production and for UAT. The whole project is implemented this way, except for date pickers. It's currently impossible to do this with the MudDatePicker, as it currently uses DateTime.Today to determine the current date.

### Describe the solution you'd like

It should be possible to inject a custom DateTime provider, that would allow users to set a different "current" date on the component.

### Have you seen this feature anywhere else?

_No response_

_No response_
